armGroups.label: ACDF - Control Group
interventionNames: Device: Anterior Cervical Discectomy and Fusion (ACDF)

outcomeMeasures.title: Individual Patient Overall Success
outcomeMeasures.description: Individual patient overall success defined as ≥20% improvement in Neck Disability Index (NDI) from preoperative score, no device failures requiring revision, reoperation or removal, and the absence of radiographic or major complications during the 24-month follow-up period.

outcomeMeasures.title: Neck Pain Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Improvement of ≥20mm in neck pain at 24 months compared to baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Neck Pain Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean neck pain at 24 months on a 0-100 mm Visual Analog Scale (lower value is better).

outcomeMeasures.title: Worst Arm Pain Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Improvement of ≥20mm in worst arm pain at 24 months compared to baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Worst Arm Pain Visual Analog Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean worst arm pain at 24 months on a 0-100mm Visual Analog Scale (lower value is better).

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinically Significant Improvement on Neck Disability Index (NDI)
outcomeMeasures.description: Improvement in NDI of ≥20% at 24 months compared to baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinically Significant Improvement on Neck Disability Index (NDI)
outcomeMeasures.description: Improvement in NDI of ≥15-points at 24 months compared to baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Neck Disability Index (NDI)
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean NDI at 24 months on a 0-100 scale (lower value is better).

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinically Significant Improvement on SF-36 Physical Component Summary (PCS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Improvement of ≥15% on SF-36 PCS at 24 months compared to baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean SF-36 Physical Component Summary (PCS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean SF-36 PCS at 24 months on a 0-100 scale (lower value is better).

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinically Significant Improvement on SF-36 Mental Component Summary (MCS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Improvement of ≥15% on the SF-36 MCS at 24 months compared to baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean SF-36 Mental Component Summary (MCS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean SF-36 MCS at 24 months on a 0-100 scale (lower value is better).

outcomeMeasures.title: Dysphagia for Swallowing
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean dysphagia for swallowing at 24 months on a 0-100mm Visual Analog Scale (lower value is better).

outcomeMeasures.title: Patient Satisfaction
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean Patient Satisfaction at 24 months on a 0-100 Visual Analog Scale (higher value is better).

outcomeMeasures.title: Nurick's Classification of Disability (Myelopathy)
outcomeMeasures.description: Maintenance or improvement in Nurick's Classification from baseline to 24 months. Nurick's classification is a six-point scale, graded 0 to 5. A grade of 0 indicates no symptoms at all, while a grade of 5 is a bed or chair-bound patient. A patient "maintained" if their Nurick classification grade remained the same or "improved" if it decreased from baseline to 24 months.

outcomeMeasures.title: Flexion/Extension Range of Motion at the Operative Level
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean flexion/extension range of motion at operative level at 24 months. The operative level is defined as the cervical spinal level at which the surgical procedure was performed.
